architectural_decisions.title: Microservices Architecture
architectural_decisions.rationale: To ensure scalability, maintainability, and security.

architectural_decisions.title: Use of FastAPI for REST API
architectural_decisions.rationale: FastAPI provides fast performance, easy to use, and built-in support for asynchronous code.

architectural_decisions.title: Pydantic for Data Validation
architectural_decisions.rationale: Pydantic offers robust data validation, automatic generation of schemas, and easy integration with FastAPI.

architectural_decisions.title: Repository Pattern for Data Access Layer
architectural_decisions.rationale: The Repository Pattern simplifies data access logic, promotes separation of concerns, and enables easier testing.

architectural_decisions.title: Dependency Injection via FastAPI
architectural_decisions.rationale: Dependency injection improves modularity, testability, and maintainability.

architectural_decisions.title: Custom Error Handling with HTTPException
architectural_decisions.rationale: HTTPException allows for custom error responses and better control over error handling.

architectural_decisions.title: Support for Multiple Payment Providers
architectural_decisions.rationale: Enabling flexibility in choosing payment gateways based on business needs and regional preferences.

architectural_decisions.title: JWT Token-based Authentication
architectural_decisions.rationale: JWT tokens provide secure, stateless authentication and simplify authorization enforcement.

architectural_decisions.title: ORM for Database Interactions
architectural_decisions.rationale: ORM simplifies database operations, reduces boilerplate code, and promotes code reusability.

architectural_decisions.title: Email Confirmation Notifications
architectural_decisions.rationale: Confirmation emails enhance user experience by providing immediate feedback on order creation.

components.name: orders
components.description: Provides REST API endpoints for order management.

components.name: processor
components.description: Handles payment processing for the e-commerce API.

Create a New Order.description: This endpoint allows users to create a new order by providing order items, shipping address, and payment method.

steps.description: Include request body with items, shipping address, and payment method
Handle response containing order ID, status, total, items, created at timestamp
Handle error cases: 400 (validation failure), 500 (payment processing failure)

Get Order Details.description: This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific order by its ID. Users can only access their own orders.

steps.description: Handle response containing order ID, status, total, items, created at timestamp
Handle error cases: 404 (order not found), 403 (unauthorized access)

List User Orders.description: This endpoint lists all orders for the current user, supporting pagination via limit and offset parameters.

steps.description: Include query parameters for limit and offset
Handle response containing list of orders

Cancel an Order.description: This endpoint allows users to cancel a pending order. Orders that are processing or shipped cannot be cancelled.

steps.description: Handle response containing cancellation success message
Handle error cases: 404 (order not found), 403 (unauthorized access), 400 (order status not 'pending')
